Itemdex

Items

Name Description
Adrenaline Orb Boosts Speed if intimidated. Initiates SoS battles.
Amulet Coin Doubles money in battle if the holder takes part.
Balm Mushroom A rare mushroom that can be sold at a high price.
Big Mushroom A rare mushroom that would sell at a high price.
Big Nugget A big nugget of pure gold that can be sold at a high price.
Big Pearl A lovely large pearl that would sell at a high price.
Black Flute A glass flute that keeps away wild Pokémon.
Blue Flute A glass flute that awakens sleeping Pokémon.
Blue Shard A colorful shard of sea glass. Someone might be interested in this.
Cleanse Tag A hold item that helps repel wild Pokémon.
Comet Shard A shard that fell from the sky. It can be sold at a high price.
CPU Module A CPU Module. It may be useful to someone…
Dark Roast The strong aroma attracts several wild Pokémon for battle.
Destiny Knot If the holder becomes infatuated, the foe does too.
Escape Rope Use to escape instantly from a cave or a dungeon.
Espresso The bold aroma attracts a horde of wild Pokémon for battle.
Everstone A wondrous item to be held by a Pokémon to prevent it from evolving.
Exp. Share A hold item that gets Exp. Points from battles.
GPU Module A GPU Module. It may be useful to someone…
Green Shard A colorful shard of sea glass. Someone might be interested in this.
Heart Scale A lovely scale. It is coveted by collectors.
Honey A sweet honey that attracts salivating wild Pokémon.
Light Roast The delicate aroma attracts a wild Pokémon for battle.
Lucky Egg A hold item that boosts Exp. points earned in battle.
Lure Makes Pokémon more likely to appear for 100 steps.
Macho Brace A hold item that promotes growth, but reduces Speed.
Max Lure Makes Pokémon more likely to appear for 250 steps.
Max Repel Repels weak wild Pokémon for 250 steps.
Medium Roast The balanced aroma attracts a couple wild Pokémon for battle.
Meteor Sliver A meteorite shard. Some collectors may be interested in it.
Nugget A nugget of pure gold. Can be sold at a high price.
Pearl A pretty pearl that would sell at a cheap price.
Pearl String Very large pearls that can be sold at a high price to shops.
Power Anklet A hold item that promotes Speed gain, but reduces Speed.
Power Band Hold item that promotes Sp. Def gain, but reduces Speed.
Power Belt A hold item that promotes Def gain, but reduces Speed.
Power Bracer A hold item that promotes Atk gain, but reduces Speed.
Power Lens Hold item that promotes Sp. Atk gain, but reduces Speed.
Power Weight A hold item that promotes HP gain, but reduces Speed.
Pretty Feather A beautiful yet plain feather that does nothing.
Rare Bone A very rare bone. It can be sold at a high price.
Red Flute A glass flute that snaps Pokémon out of attraction.
Red Shard A colorful shard of sea glass. Someone might be interested in this.
Repel Repels weak wild Pokémon for 100 steps.
Shoal Salt Salt obtained from deep inside the Shoal Cave.
Shoal Shell A seashell found deep inside the Shoal Cave.
Soothe Bell A hold item that calms spirits and fosters friendship.
Star Piece A red gem shard. It would sell for a very high price.
Stardust Beautiful red sand. Can be sold at a high price.
Super Lure Makes Pokémon more likely to appear for 200 steps.
Super Repel Repels weak wild Pokémon for 200 steps.
Tiny Mushroom A plain mushroom that would sell at a cheap price.
White Flute A glass flute that lures wild Pokémon.
Yellow Flute A glass flute that snaps Pokémon out of confusion.
Yellow Shard A colorful shard of sea glass. Someone might be interested in this.

Medicine

Name Description
Antidote Heals a poisoned Pokémon.
Apple Pie A savory pie that heals 100 HP and status conditions.
Awakening Awakens a sleeping Pokémon.
Berry Juice A 100% pure juice that restores HP by 20 points.
Big Malasada Heals all the status problems of one Pokémon.
Blueberry Pie A savory pie that heals 100 HP and all move PP by 10.
Burn Heal Heals Pokémon of a burn.
Casteliacone Heals all the status problems of one Pokémon.
Cherry Pie A savory pie that heals 100 HP and boosts Sp. Atk in battle.
Chocolate Pie A savory pie that heals 100 HP and boosts Speed in battle.
Elixir Restores the PP of all moves by 10.
Energy Powder A bitter powder that restores HP by 60 points.
Energy Root A bitter root that restores HP by 120 points.
Ether Restores the PP of a selected move by 10.
Fetid Potion Restores 150 HP but burns and lowers base stats.
Fresh Water A mineral water that restores HP by 30 points.
Full Heal Heals all the status problems of one Pokémon.
Full Restore Fully restores the HP and status of a Pokémon.
Heal Powder A bitter powder that heals all status problems.
Hyper Potion Restores the HP of a Pokémon by 120 points.
Ice Heal Defrosts a frostbitten Pokémon.

King Mushroom A rare mushroom that restores 100 HP.
Lava Cookie A local specialty that heals all status problems.
Lemonade A very sweet drink that restores HP by 70 points.
Lumiose Galette Heals all the status problems of one Pokémon.
Max Elixir Fully restores the PP of a Pokémon's moves.
Max Ether Fully restores the PP of a selected move.
Max Potion Fully restores the HP of a Pokémon.

Moon Muffin A delicious treat that restores HP by 65 points.

Paralyze Heal Heals a paralyzed Pokémon.

Revival Herb A very bitter herb that revives a fainted Pokémon.
Revive Revives a fainted Pokémon with half its HP.

Shalour Sable Heals all the status problems of one Pokémon.

Sweet Heart A sweet chocolate that restores HP by 20 points.
Tainted Potion Restores 90 HP but poisons and lowers base stats.
Vivid Mushroom An interesting-looking mushroom that restores PP of all moves by 10.

Poké Balls

Name Description
Assault Ball A ball that works well on very offensive Pokémon.
Beast Ball A ball that works well on monsters and dragons.
Brawl Ball A ball that works well on Fighting-and Normal-types.
Breeder Ball A ball that works well on Pokémon that can breed.
Cirrus Ball Works well on Water-, Ice-, and Flying-types.
Dive Ball A ball that works better on Pokémon on the ocean floor.
Dream Ball A ball that works better on sleeping Pokémon.
Dusk Ball A ball that works well if used in a dark place.
Effort Ball A ball that inflicts a virus on the Pokémon.
Emerald Ball Works well on Pokémon that evolve from certain stones.
Expert Ball A beautiful ball crafted by an Expert.
Fable Ball A ball that works well on Fairy-and Dragon-types.
Feather Ball A ball that works well on very light Pokémon.
Fortress Ball A ball that works well on very defensive Pokémon.
Friend Ball A ball that makes a Pokémon friendly when caught.
Great Ball A good ball with a higher catch rate than a Poké Ball.
Heavy Ball A ball that works well on very heavy Pokémon.
Level Ball A ball that works well on lower level Pokémon.
Lichen Ball A ball that works well on Grass-and Rock-type Pokémon.
Lure Ball A ball that works well on fished Pokémon.
Luxury Ball A cozy ball that makes Pokémon more friendly.
Magnet Ball A ball that works well on Steel-and Electric-types.
Master Ball The best ball that catches a Pokémon without fail.
Moon Ball A ball that works well on Moon Stone users.
Nest Ball A ball that works better on weaker Pokémon.
Net Ball A ball that works well on Water-and Bug-type Pokémon.
Paradox Ball A ball that works well on Dark-and Psychic-type Pokémon.
Park Ball A special ball that is used only in Catching Contests.
Poké Ball A tool used for catching wild Pokémon.
Premier Ball A rare ball with a higher critical capture rate.
Quick Ball A ball that works well if used on the first turn.
Relic Ball An ancient ball prototype from ancient times.
Repeat Ball A ball that works better on Pokémon caught before.
Shiny Ball A ball that works better on shiny Pokémon.
Sulfur Ball A ball that works well on Fire-and Poison-type Pokémon.
Swift Ball A ball that works well on very fast Pokémon.
Timer Ball A ball that gains power in battles taking many turns.
Tomb Ball A ball that works well on Ghost-and Ground-types.
Ultra Ball A better ball with a higher catch rate than a Great Ball.

Battle

Name Description
Ability Shield Ability changes are prevented for this items's holder.
Absorb Bulb Raises Sp. Atk. if the holder is hit by a Water-type move.
Adrenaline Amp Grants a minor boost to the holder's Speed.
Air Balloon Elevates the holder in the air. If hit, this item will burst.
Airfoil Raises Speed if its holder is hit by a Flying-type move.
Arctic Seed Consume and sharply boost Sp. Def in Arctic Terrain.
Arid Seed Consume and sharply boost Defense in Arid Terrain.
Assault Vest Raises Sp. Def but prevents the use of status moves.
Berserk Gene Confuses the holder to sharply raise Atk upon switch-in.
Big Root A held item that boosts the power of HP-stealing moves.
Binding Band Increases the power of binding moves when held.
Black Belt A hold item that boosts Fighting-type moves.
Black Glasses A hold item that raises the power of Dark-type moves.
Black Sludge Gradually restores HP of Poison-types. Damages others.
Blunder Policy Sharply raises Speed when the holder misses.
Blustery Seed Consume and sharply boost Speed in Blustery Terrain.
Boxing Pad Raises Atk. if its holder is hit by a Fighting-type move.
Brass Knuckles Raises the power of punching Attacks by a small margin.
Bright Powder A hold item that casts a glare to reduce accuracy.
Brittle Statue Raises Atk. if its holder is hit by a Rock-type move.
Bug Essence A consumable that grants Bug type to the holder.
Bug Gem Increases the power of Bug-type moves.
Bug Spray Raises Sp. Atk. if its holder is hit by a Bug-type move.
Cell Battery Raises Atk. if the holder is hit by an Electric-type move.
Charcoal A hold item that raises the power of Fire-type moves.
Choice Band Raises a move's power, but permits only that move.
Choice Scarf Boosts Speed, but allows the use of only one move.
Choice Specs Boosts Sp. Atk, but allows the use of only one move.
Clear Amulet Stat lowering is prevented for this items's holder.
Cloudy Crystal Consumed in battle to generate Thick Fog.
Cloudy Rock Extends the duration of Thick Fog if used by the holder.
Combat Seed Consume and sharply boost Attack in Combat Terrain.
Combat Vest Raises Def but prevents the use of status moves.
Covert Cloak Protects the holder from secondary move effects.
Damp Crystal Consumed in battle to summon Rain.
Damp Rock Extends the duration of Rain Dance if used by the holder.

Dark Essence A consumable that grants Dark type to the holder.
Dark Gem Increases the power of Dark-type moves.
Dire Hit Raises the critical-hit ratio during one battle.
Dragon Essence A consumable that grants Dragon type to the holder.
Dragon Fang A hold item that raises the power of Dragon-type moves.
Dragon Gem Increases the power of Dragon-type moves.
Eerie Seed Consume and sharply boost Defense in Eerie Terrain.
Eject Button Switches out the user if they're hit by the foe.
Eject Pack The holder is switched out when any stat lowers.
Electric Essence A consumable that grants Electric type to the holder.
Electric Gem Increases the power of Electric-type moves.

Electron Scanner Raises Sp. Atk. if its holder is hit by a Psychic-type move.
Enrage Gene Confuses the holder to sharply raise Sp. Atk upon switch-in.
Eviolite Raises the Def and Sp. Def of Pokémon that can evolve.
Expert Belt A belt that boosts the power of super effective moves.
Fairy Essence A consumable that grants Fairy type to the holder.
Fairy Feather A hold item that raises the power of Fairy-type moves.
Fairy Gem Increases the power of Fairy-type moves.

Fighting Gem Increases the power of Fighting-type moves.
Fire Essence A consumable that grants Fire type to the holder.
Fire Gem Increases the power of Fire-type moves.
Flame Orb A bizarre orb that inflicts a burn on holder in battle.

Flood Seed Consume and sharply boost Sp. Def in Flooded Terrain.
Floral Seed Consume and sharply boost Speed in Floral Terrain.
Fluffy Tail Use to flee from any battle with a wild Pokémon.
Flying Essence A consumable that grants Flying type to the holder.
Flying Gem Increases the power of Flying-type moves.
Focus Band A hold item that occasionally prevents fainting.
Focus Sash If the holder has full HP, it endures KO Attacks with 1HP.

Key Items

Name Description

TM Case

Name Move Description
TM 001 Predation The user feasts on the target's flesh, restoring its HP by half the damage caused.
TM 002 Aqua Jet The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes it almost invisible. It always goes first.
TM 003 Worry Seed A seed that causes worry is planted on the target, making all target abilities Insomnia.
TM 004 Calm Mind The user quietly focuses its mind to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.
TM 005 Toxic A move that leaves the target badly poisoned. Its poison damage worsens every turn.
TM 006 Psykogenic Chill The user drains the target's perception of warmth. This leaves it with frostbite.
TM 007 Hail The user summons a hailstorm lasting five turns. It damages all Pokémon except Ice types.
TM 008 Bulk Up The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body, raising both its Attack and Defense stats.
TM 009 Volt Switch After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon.
TM 010 Hidden Power A unique attack that varies in type depending the Pokémon's hidden type.
TM 011 Sunny Day The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering up Fire-type moves.
TM 012 Taunt The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use only attack moves for three turns.
TM 013 Blizzard A howling blizzard strikes opposing Pokémon. This may also leave them with frostbite.
TM 014 Light Screen A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from special attacks for five turns.
TM 015 Reflect A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from physical attacks for five turns.
TM 016 Aurora Veil Damage from all moves is halved for 5 turns. This move can be used only in a hailstorm.
TM 017 Protect Enables the user to evade all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
TM 018 Rain Dance The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five turns, powering up Water-type moves.
TM 019 Giga Drain A nutrient-draining attack. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
TM 020 Safeguard The user creates a protective field that prevents status conditions for five turns.
TM 021 Solar Beam A two-turn attack. The user gathers light, then blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.
TM 022 Thunderbolt A strong electric blast crashes down on the target. This may also leave it with paralysis.
TM 023 Return This full-power attack grows more powerful the more the user likes its Trainer.
TM 024 Adaptabiliteeth The user attacks with its sharp fangs. This move's type matches all of the user's types.
TM 025 Shadow Ball The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.
TM 026 Steel Wing The target is hit with wings of steel. This may also raise the user's Defense stat.
TM 027 Double Team By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of itself to raise its evasiveness.
TM 028 Shock Wave The user strikes the target with a quick jolt of electricity. This attack never misses.
TM 029 Sludge Bomb Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may also poison the target.
TM 030 Sandstorm A five-turn sandstorm is summoned to hurt all except Rock, Ground, and Steel types.
TM 031 Brick Break The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break barriers, such as Light Screen.
TM 032 Torment The user torments the target, making it incapable of using the same move twice in a row.
TM 033 Revenge This attack move's power is doubled if the target has hurt the user in the same turn.
TM 034 Secret Power The additional effects of this attack depend upon where it was used.
TM 035 Rest The user sleeps for two turns, fully restoring its HP and healing any status conditions.
TM 036 Attract If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target becomes infatuated.
TM 037 Thief The user attacks and steals the target's held item if the user isn't holding one.
TM 038 Incinerate If opposing Pokémon are holding a Berry or Gem, it becomes burned up and unusable.
TM 039 Embargo This move prevents the target and its Trainer from using (held) items for five turns.
TM 040 Body Press The user slams its body into the target. This move's power scales with the user's Defense.
TM 041 Focus Blast The user unleashes power with heightened focus. It may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.
TM 042 Glaciate The user blows freezing cold air at opposing Pokémon. This lowers their Speed stats.
TM 043 Scorching Sands The user throws scorching sand at the target. This may also leave it with a burn.
TM 044 Topsy-Turvy All stat changes affecting the target become the opposite of what they were.
TM 045 Triple Axel A consecutive three-kick attack that becomes more powerful with each hit.
TM 046 U-turn After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon.
TM 047 Power Swap The user switches changes to its Attack and Sp. Atk stats with the target.
TM 048 Guard Swap The user switches changes to its Defense and Sp. Def stats with the target.
TM 049 Speed Swap The user exchanges Speed stats with the target.
TM 050 Acrobatics If the user is not holding an item, this attack inflicts massive damage.
TM 051 Will-o-Wisp The user shoots a sinister flame at the target to inflict a burn.
TM 052 Venoshock The user drenches the target in a toxic liquid, causing double damage to poisoned targets.
TM 053 Avalanche This attack move's power is doubled if the target has hurt the user in the same turn.
TM 054 Entrainment The user compels the target to mimic it, making its abilities the same as the user's.
TM 055 Bulldoze The user strikes everything around it. This lowers the Speed stats of those hit.
TM 056 Mud Bomb The user launches a hard-packed mud ball. It may also lower a target's accuracy.
TM 057 Trick Room The user creates a bizarre area in which slower Pokémon get to move first for five turns.
TM 058 Wonder Room The user creates a bizarre area that swaps Defense and Sp. Def stats for five turns.
TM 059 Magic Room The user creates a bizarre area in which held items lose their effects for five turns.
TM 060 Marvel Room The user creates a bizarre area that swaps Attack and Sp. Atk stats for five turns.
TM 061 Ancient Power The user attacks with a prehistoric power. This may also raise all the user's stats.
TM 062 Grassy Terrain For 5 turns, the HP of grounded Pokémon is restored and Grass type-moves are stronger.
TM 063 Electric Terrain For 5 turns, grounded Pokémon stay awake and Electric-type moves are stronger.
TM 064 Misty Terrain For 5 turns, grounded Pokémon's status is protected and Dragon-type moves are weaker.
TM 065 Psychic Terrain Grounded Pokémon are safe from priority and Psychic-type moves are stronger for 5 turns.
TM 066 Floral Terrain For 5 turns, healing effects and Bug type-moves are stronger.
TM 067 Arid Terrain For 5 turns, grounded Pokémon take no recoil damage and Water type-moves are weaker.
TM 068 Muddy Terrain For 5 turns, muddy and ballstic moves as well as Ground type-moves are stronger.
TM 069 Primal Terrain For 5 turns, STAB is ignored and Dragon type-moves are stronger.
TM 070 Eerie Terrain For 5 turns, protection moves cannot be used, and Ghost type-moves are stronger.
TM 071 Flooded Terrain For 5 turns, Pokémon incapable of learning Surf are slowed and Water type-moves are stronger.
TM 072 Shrapnel Terrain For 5 turns, grounded Pokémon take recoil damage and Steel type-moves are stronger.
TM 073 Magma Terrain For 5 turns, the effects of healing moves are reduced and Fire type-moves are stronger.
TM 074 Arctic Terrain For 5 turns, Ice type-Pokémon and Ice type-moves are stronger.
TM 075 Morbid Terrain For 5 turns, stat reductions are worse and Dark type-moves are stronger.
TM 076 Combat Terrain For 5 turns, contact effects are more likely and Fighting type-moves are stronger.
TM 077 Blustery Terrain For 5 turns, all Pokémon Levitate and Flying type-moves are stronger.
TM 078 Noxious Terrain For 5 turns, grounded Pokémon are Tormented and Poison type-moves are stronger.
TM 079 Inverse Terrain For 5 turns, type effectiveness is inverted.
TM 080 Bug Bite The user bites. If the target is holding a Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.
TM 081 Surf The user attacks everything around it by swamping its surroundings with a giant wave.
TM 082 Fly The user flies up into the sky and then strikes its target on the next turn.
TM 083 Strength The target is slugged with a punch thrown at maximum power.
TM 084 Ominous Wind The target is blasted with a gust of repulsive wind. It may also raise all the user's stats.
TM 085 Gyro Ball The user tackles the target with a high-speed spin. The slower the user, the better.
TM 086 Dazzling Gleam The user damages opposing Pokémon by emitting a powerful flash.
TM 087 Wood Hammer The user slams its rugged body into the target to attack but is also damaged quite a lot.
TM 088 Blubber Bump The user blubs into the target. This move's power scales with the user's Sp. Def stat.
TM 089 Acid Rain A five-turn acid rain is summoned, empowering Poison-type moves.
TM 090 Thunderstorm Summons a five-turn booming thunderstorm which damages non-Electric types each turn.
TM 091 Thick Fog The user covers the battlefield with a thick fog that lowers the accuracy of all Pokémon.
TM 092 Solar Flare The user magnetizes the air to summon a Solar Wind.
TM 093 Pyroclasm The user pressurizes the battlefield to summon an arid heat wave.
TM 094 Breaking Swipe The user swings its tough tail at opposing Pokémon. This also lowers their Attack stats.
TM 095 Endothermia The user absorbs thermal energy, restoring its HP by half of the damage caused.
TM 096 Polar Plunge The target is crushed by ice cold water. This may leave it with paralysis.
TM 097 Volt Overload The user attacks the target by blowing a circuit. This may leave it with a burn.
TM 098 Bramble Snag The user shreds the target with sharp brambles. This also lowers its Speed stat.
TM 099 Magical Leaf The user scatters curious leaves that chase the target. This attack never misses.
TM 100 Psybeam The target is attacked with a peculiar ray. This may also leave the target confused.
TM 101 Rock Wrecker The user launches a huge boulder at the target but can't move on the next turn.
TM 102 Sprite Smash The user launches a pixelated slam. The recoil harshly lowers the user's Attack stat.
TM 103 Simoom A violent wind that hurls sand and rocks at opposing foes. It may lower their Sp. Def stats.
TM 104 Stomping Tantrum If the user's previous move has failed, its frustration doubles the power of this move.
TM 105 Bug Buzz The user vibrates to generate a damaging sound wave. It may lower the target's Sp. Def stat.
TM 106 Knock Off The user slaps down the target's held item, doing more damage if it holds one.
TM 107 Ice Beam The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of energy which may leave it with frostbite.
TM 108 Hyper Beam The target is attacked with a powerful beam. The user can't move on the next turn.
TM 109 Flamethrower The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire and may be left with a burn.
TM 110 Fire Blast The target is hit with a blast of all-consuming fire. This may also leave it with a burn.
TM 111 Skill Swap The user employs its psychic power to exchange Abilities with the target.
TM 112 Water Pulse The user attacks the target with a pulsing blast of water. This may also confuse it.
TM 113 Dizzy Punch The target is hit with rhythmically launched punches and may be left confused.
TM 114 Hydro Pump The target is blasted by a huge volume of water launched under great pressure.
TM 115 Mind Blown The user causes its own head to explode, damaging the user and everything around it.
TM 116 Dark Pulse The user releases a horrible aura full of dark thoughts. It may also make a target flinch.
TM 117 Giga Impact The user charges at the target using every bit of its power but can't move on the next turn.
TM 118 Wild Charge The user shrouds itself in electricity and smashes into its target, but is damaged a little.
TM 119 Jettison After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon.
TM 120 Play Rough The user plays rough with the target and attacks it. This may also lower its Attack stat.
TM 121 Thunder A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target. This may also leave it with paralysis.
TM 122 Earthquake The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every Pokémon around it.
TM 123 Expanding Force This move's power goes up and damages all opposing Pokémon on Psychic Terrain.
TM 124 Role Play The user mimics the target completely, copying the target's abilities.
TM 125 Muddy Water The user shoots muddy water at opposing Pokémon. This may also lower their accuracy.
TM 126 Flip Turn After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon.
TM 127 Behemoth Bash The user becomes a gigantic shield that deals double damage to infused targets.

Disc Case

Name Ability Description
Disc 01 Battle Armor Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.
Disc 02 Pickup The Pokémon may pick up the items, both during and outside of battle.
Disc 03 Own Tempo This Pokémon has its own tempo, and that prevents it from becoming confused.
Disc 04 Insomnia The Pokémon is suffering from insomnia and cannot fall asleep.
Disc 05 Immunity The immune system of the Pokémon prevents it from getting poisoned.
Disc 06 Keen Eye Prevents other Pokémon from lowering this Pokémon's accuracy.
Disc 07 Illuminate Raises the Pokémon's evasiveness.
Disc 08 Trace When it enters a battle, the Pokémon copies an opposing Pokémon's Ability.
Disc 09 Swarm Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.
Disc 10 Water Veil The Pokémon is covered with a water veil, which prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.
Disc 11 Ball Fetch If the Pokémon is not holding an item, it will fetch the first failed thrown Poké Ball.
Disc 12 Sturdy It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out, either.
Disc 13 Cloud Nine Eliminates the effects of weather.
Disc 14 Flash Fire Powers up the Pokémon's Fire-type moves if it's hit by one.
Disc 15 Lightning Rod The Pokémon draws in and neutralises Electric-type moves, boosting its Sp. Atk.
Disc 16 Lifelink The Pokémon may restore some of its HP after making contact.
Disc 17 Mimicry Changes the Pokémon's type depending on the terrain.
Disc 18 Liquid Voice All sound-based moves become Water-type moves.
Disc 19 Sand Force Boosts the power of Rock-, Ground-, and Steel-type moves in a sandstorm.
Disc 20 Rock Head Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.
Disc 21 Poison Heal Restores HP if the Pokémon is poisoned instead of losing HP.
Disc 22 Shadow Tag This Pokémon steps on the opposing Pokémon's shadow to prevent it from escaping.
Disc 23 Frostproof The Pokémon resists Ice-type moves and damage from frostbite.
Disc 24 Levitate By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.
Disc 25 Super Luck The Pokémon is so lucky that the critical-hit ratios of its moves are boosted.
Disc 26 Polluter The Pokémon summons acid rain when it enters battle.
Disc 27 Snow Warning The Pokémon summons a hailstorm when it enters a battle.
Disc 28 Solid Rock Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken.
Disc 29 Sand Spit The Pokémon creates a sandstorm when it's hit by an attack.
Disc 30 Frozen Body Contact with the Pokémon may cause frostbite.
Disc 31 Technician Powers up the Pokémon's weaker moves.
Disc 32 Storm Drain The Pokémon draws in and neutralises Water-type moves, boosting its Sp. Atk.
Disc 33 Strong Jaw The Pokémon's strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.
Disc 34 Liquid Ooze The oozed liquid has a strong stench, which damages attackers using draining moves.
Disc 35 Neuroforce Powers up moves that are super effective.
Disc 36 Quark Drive Boosts the Pokémon's most proficient stat on Electric Terrain.
Disc 37 Stagnant Air The Pokémon generates a heat wave when it enters battle.
Disc 38 Compound Eyes The Pokémon's compound eyes boost its accuracy.
Disc 39 Swift Swim Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.
Disc 40 Sand Stream The Pokémon summons a sandstorm when it enters a battle.
Disc 41 Limber Its limber body protects the Pokémon from paralysis.
Disc 42 Magma Armor The Pokémon is covered with hot magma, which prevents it from becoming frostbitten.
Disc 43 Sand Veil Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in a sandstorm.
Disc 44 Fog Veil Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in thick fog.
Disc 45 Toxic Boost Powers up physical attacks when the Pokémon is poisoned.
Disc 46 Flare Boost Powers up special attacks when the Pokémon is burned.
Disc 47 Frost Boost Powers up special attacks when the Pokémon is frostbitten.
Disc 48 Oblivious The Pokémon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or taunted.
Disc 49 Cecity This Pokémon's poor eyesight makes its moves more likely to miss.
Disc 50 Damp Prevents the use of explosive moves, such as Self-Destruct, by dampening its surroundings.
